document.discussion_title: Phil_Edmeades published A50 closure update: man threatened to jump from bridge
document.topic_text: Comments (0) Police closed one side of the busy A50 through the city last night after reports of a man threatening to jump from a bridge. Police and other emergency services were called to the bridge over the westbound A50 near the Tesco roundabout between Meir and Blythe Bridge at 11.50pm following reports from motorists that a man in a distressed state was threatening to jump onto the carriageway below. Read more: A50 westbound closed due to police incident in Meir Officers closed the westbound carriageway to all traffic while they talked to the man and persuaded him to return to a place of safety. A Staffordshire Police spokesman said: "A man was threatening to jump from the bridge and officers closed the road as a precaution while they talked to him and persuaded him not to carry out his threat. Read more: Delays expected at Cobridge traffic lights as council begins work for up to eight weeks "The incident was resolved fairly quickly and no one was injured." Police have not released any details about the man or what happened to him after last night's incident which lasted for about an hour.
